name: Tattered Hat
desc: Itchy and filthy, it offers almost no protection

name: Tattered Shirt
desc: A standard-issue peasant shirt

name: Tattered Pants
desc: Not comfy. Not protective.

name: Worn Gloves
desc: The gloves of a worker. They offer little-to-no actual defense.

name: Farmer's Boots
desc: Farmers don't normally fight horrific monsters, so these aren't exactly reassuring.

name: Cook's Ring
desc: A cook's best friend, this little trinket offers defense against not checking your stovetop before touching it.

name: Boiled Leather Cuirass
desc: While not as protective as a metal chestpiece, this armor is much lighter. It's also a lot more brittle, so try not to get hit.

name: Boiled Leather Leggings
desc: Sometimes quick movement is preferable to standing there and getting hit. Boiled leather armor goes that route. Also, the curing process makes it smell a bit like piss. So there's that.

name: Weekend Shirt
desc: You wore this last time you were out with the bros. It's pretty dank.

name: Parachute Pants
desc: The 1980's called. They want their pants back.

name: Gardening Gloves
desc: These aren't exactly designed for fighting monsters. Unless by 'monsters', you mean weeds, and by 'fighting', you mean tending Grandma's veggie patch.

name: Sneakers from the Back of the Closet
desc: You know, that pair that you haven't seen in years. Really comfy, but also really weak.

name: Mets Hat
desc: Show your support for the New York Mets! Keep the sun out of your face! Protect against pretty much nothing!

name: Hardened Leather Skullcap
desc: A mid-level helmet, this skullcap will protect you from minor boo-boos.

name: Hardened Leather Breastplate
desc: Not nearly as protective as metal armor, but a lot more comfy.

name: Hardened Leather Leggings
desc: They chafe a bit. They also protect your sensitive areas a bit, so that's good.

name: Hardened Leather Bracers
desc: Via a complex curing process involving many nasty chemicals, the original cow hide is transformed into something that makes digging the weeds a lot easier.

name: Hardened Leather Greaves
desc: They kinda smell after a while.

name: Cleric Robes
desc: So holy you can feel the self-righteousness oozing off of them.

name: Robes of the Damned
desc: Damn, these are nice robes!

name: Steel Brigandine
desc: Made from tempered steel, it makes you feel all nice and safe.

name: Steel Greaves
desc: Large, metal boots certainly don't make you stealthy. But who needs stealthy when you've got large, metal boots?

name: Steel Gauntlets
desc: The tempered steel of these gauntlets provides important protection against crushed fingers, but also makes drawing rude things on your enemy after battle much more difficult.

name: Steel Chauses
desc: Because getting kicked in the groin is really just not that fun

name: Steel Cervelliere
desc: The decision not to use facial protection is a trade off: much higher visibility and breathability, but also a much higher chance of getting decked in the face.

name: Nasal Helmet
desc: Rather uncomfortable, the Nasal Helmet is a primitive helmet that provides no real benefits.

name: Splint Helmet
desc: Made of overlapping strips of iron on a leather base, this is actually rather effective at keeping your noggin working.

name: Cloth cap
desc: Surprisingly, a simple cloth cap does offer some protection against damage. Not much though.

name: Silk Armor Cap
desc: The intricate weave of a silk cap provides much protection against small arrows. Not much against large hammers, however.

name: Ring of the Defender
desc: Somehow, wearing this tiny trinket on your finger provides protection against physical damage.

name: Ring of the Cryomancer
desc: Stop crying. It's not that cold.

name: Ring of the Guardian
desc: This glowy little ring just makes you feel better. How nice.

name: Cook's Necklace
desc: Pro-tip: If this thing is on fire, you're probably too close to the stove.

name: Defender's Necklace
desc: Priestly wards imbue this otherwise unremarkable necklace, providing extra protection against physical damage

name: Cryomancer's Necklace
desc: The coldest of attacks won't quite be as threatening while you wear this. Also, it's pretty stylish.

name: Light-Imbued Necklace
desc: As guardians of the light, the paladins wear these tiny trinkets as symbols of their fight against the darkness.

name: Splint Leg Guards
desc: The small pieces of armor that make up these leggings may not seem like much, but sometimes 'not much' is all you need between you and an enemy.

name: Rough Splint Mail
desc: The most basic of heavy armors, this provides only moderate defense.

name: Boiled Leather Boots
desc: These have a slight foul odor, but they protect your feet!

name: Rough Leather Boots
desc: These offer only the most basic defense against getting your toes trod on.

name: Boiled Leather Gloves
desc: While initially stiff, they're eventually quite comfy.

name: Splint Gloves
desc: The splints that make up these allow a maximum of dexterity. They also allow a maximum of crushed fingers.

name: Tattered Gloves
desc: These gloves have seen better days.

name: Silk Boots
desc: These rather comfy boots also are incredibly stealthy. Too bad this game has no stealth mechanic

name: Silk Gloves
desc: If nothing else, at least they make you feel fancy.

name: Cloth Weave Boots
desc: The intricate weave of these provides significant protection

name: Silk Leggings
desc: They make you feel all comfy. Like pajamas

name: Crossweave Greaves
desc: They protect your bits! And they rhyme!
